metadata.chain_name: PMC Community Standard - Enhanced Missing Child Protocol
metadata.description: The Project Milk Carton Community Standard exceeds federal baseline requirements. Designed for parents, communities, and advocacy groups to ensure no child falls through the cracks. When agencies fail, communities act.
metadata.philosophy: Federal law sets the FLOOR. PMC sets the STANDARD. Every minute matters. Every system failure is documented. Every child deserves maximum effort.
metadata.legal_framework: Fully compliant with all federal laws while implementing ENHANCED timelines and community coordination that exceed minimum requirements.

pmc_enhanced_timelines.description: PMC timelines are FASTER than federal minimums. These are community expectations, not legal requirements.

report_acceptance.pmc_standard: Immediate with WRITTEN confirmation within 5 minutes

ncic_entry.pmc_standard: Within 30 minutes with confirmation to family

ncmec_notification.pmc_standard: Within 2 hours - family can do this directly if agency hasn't

investigator_assignment.pmc_standard: Within 4 hours with direct contact info provided

risk_assessment.pmc_standard: Within 1 hour using PMC Risk Matrix

amber_alert_decision.pmc_standard: Within 2 hours of criteria being met

community_notification.pmc_standard: Within 4 hours via PMC Community Alert Network

case_status_to_family.pmc_standard: Every 4 hours for first 72 hours, then daily

golden_hours_protocol.description: Hour-by-hour action protocol for the critical first 72 hours. Designed for families and community coordinators.

hour_0.name: IMMEDIATE (0-15 minutes)

actions.details: State clearly: 'My child is missing. I need to file a missing child report immediately.'
actions.document: Record: time of call, dispatcher name, what they said

actions.details: Do not hang up without a case number. Write it down.
actions.escalation: If refused, state: 'Federal law prohibits waiting periods for missing children under 21. I need a case number now.'

actions.details: Ask: 'When will my child be entered into NCIC? Federal law requires within 2 hours.'

do_not_do: Do not clean or disturb child's room
Do not delete any text messages or social media
Do not wait to see if they come home

actions.details: Recent photo (within 6 months), physical description, what they were wearing, known associates, social media accounts, cell phone number
Friend's houses, school, regular hangouts - call, don't go (you need to be reachable)
actions.document: Record everywhere you called and response

actions.details: Screenshot child's social media, save text messages, note last known phone location
actions.important: Do NOT log into their accounts - just screenshot from outside

actions.details: Who saw them last? Write down names and contact info for police
actions.document: Record every person who had contact

actions.details: Call non-emergency line and ask: 'Has my child been entered into NCIC yet? What is the entry time?'
actions.escalation: If not entered after 2 hours, this is a federal law violation. Escalate to supervisor.

actions.details: 1-800-THE-LOST (1-800-843-5678). Provide all information. Get NCMEC case number.
actions.important: You do NOT need to wait for police to do this. You can report directly.

actions.details: Contact community coordinator, faith community, school, neighbors
One person handles all media/community communication
actions.important: Keep one phone line clear for tips and agency calls

actions.details: Ask: 'Who is the assigned investigator? I need their direct contact information.'
actions.document: Record investigator name, badge number, direct phone, email

actions.details: List of everyone child knows, places they go, any concerning contacts, any conflicts at home or school
actions.important: Be completely honest - investigators need real information

actions.details: Ask: 'Has a risk assessment been completed? What is my child's risk classification?'
actions.escalation: If child has ANY of these, insist on ENDANGERED status: under 13, special needs, in danger from someone, history of exploitation

actions.details: One designated person manages social media campaign
actions.caution: Do not post details that could tip off abductor or compromise investigation

actions.details: If child is endangered: 'Has AMBER Alert criteria been evaluated? What was the decision?'
actions.escalation: If criteria met but denied, request written explanation and escalate to state AMBER coordinator

actions.details: Work with law enforcement to coordinate volunteer searches
actions.important: Searchers should work in pairs, carry phones, report finds immediately - DO NOT TOUCH EVIDENCE

actions.details: Flyers to bus stations, truck stops, hospitals, shelters within 100-mile radius
actions.resource: NCMEC can create missing child posters

actions.details: Contact local TV news assignment desks. Provide high-quality photo and brief factual statement.
actions.timing: Evening news deadlines are typically 3-4 PM

actions.details: Ask: 'What other agencies are involved? Has FBI been notified?'
actions.escalation: After 24 hours, federal law presumes interstate transport - FBI should be involved

actions.details: Formal meeting with investigator and supervisor to review all actions taken
If child is a runaway, foster child, or has history of exploitation: 'Has trafficking screening been completed?'
Note any delays, refusals, or concerning responses from agencies
actions.important: This documentation may be needed later for accountability

actions.details: Request daily in-person or phone briefing from lead investigator
actions.pmc_standard: PMC standard is update every 12 hours minimum

actions.details: After 24 hours, confirm FBI has been notified
actions.escalation: If local agency hasn't notified FBI, you can contact FBI field office directly

actions.details: For cases beyond 24-48 hours, request NamUs entry or enter yourself
Rotate search teams, maintain flyer distribution, keep social media active
actions.important: Keep momentum - cases that go quiet get deprioritized

actions.details: Request weekly case reviews, provide any new information immediately
actions.pmc_standard: Never accept 'we'll call you if something develops'

actions.details: NCIC, NCMEC, NamUs entries must remain active while child is missing
actions.important: Case CANNOT be closed while child is still missing

actions.details: Request DNA collection from family members for database
actions.resource: NamUs provides free DNA collection kits

actions.details: Connect with missing children organizations for ongoing support

pmc_risk_matrix.description: Enhanced risk assessment matrix. If ANY of these factors are present, child should be classified as ENDANGERED.

endangered_criteria.rationale: Young children cannot survive independently; vulnerability is absolute
Child may be unable to seek help or communicate danger
Medical emergency if medication not available
Non-family abduction is highest risk category

endangered_criteria.factor: With person who may harm them
Missing from foster care or group home
endangered_criteria.rationale: Foster youth are disproportionately targeted by traffickers

never_dismiss: Never classify a missing child as 'low priority'
Never assume a teen runaway is 'voluntary' without assessment
Never delay based on 'they'll probably come back'
Never deprioritize based on race, socioeconomic status, or neighborhood

pmc_community_alert_network.description: Community-based rapid notification system that supplements official channels.
pmc_community_alert_network.purpose: When agencies are slow or unresponsive, communities can act.
activation_triggers: AMBER Alert not issued but family believes child is in danger
4+ hours since report with no visible search activity

required_info: Child's first name (no last name for safety)
What they were wearing when last seen
Case number (proves this is real report)
Who to call with information (tip line, not family phone)
do_not_include: Details about suspects (unless cleared by police)

distribution_network.method: Alert to all churches/mosques/synagogues in 25-mile radius
Alert to school districts in area (if school in session)
Flyers to gas stations, convenience stores, truck stops
Bus stations, train stations, rideshare drivers

distribution_network.caution: Single source of truth to prevent misinformation

roles: Communications coordinator - manages social media and media relations
Family liaison - supports family needs (food, childcare for siblings)
Documentation coordinator - tracks all actions and responses
Flyer coordinator - manages printing and distribution
safety_rules: Carry charged phone at all times
Do not approach suspects - call police
Do not touch potential evidence - mark and report
Check in hourly with search coordinator

foster_care_integration.description: Enhanced protocols for missing children with child welfare involvement.
foster_care_integration.cross_reference: Links to ARIA Child Welfare Decision Chains
special_considerations: Foster children are disproportionately victims of trafficking
Biological parents have rights to be notified
CPS caseworker must be involved in search
Placement history may indicate where child went
Prior abuse may be factor in running away

mandatory_actions.action: Notify biological parents (if rights not terminated)

parent_advocacy_for_bio_parents: You have a right to be notified if your child in foster care goes missing
You can file a missing person report yourself
Document any failures by CPS to report or search
Contact child welfare ombudsman if agency is unresponsive

agency_accountability_tracker.description: Documentation system for tracking agency performance and failures.
agency_accountability_tracker.purpose: Hold agencies accountable and provide evidence for complaints, lawsuits, or policy advocacy.
document_for_each_contact: Person's name, title, badge number (if applicable)

failure_categories.escalation: CPS director, state licensing, federal ACF

complaint_resources.file_with: Police Internal Affairs, Mayor's Office, City Council
Attorney General, State Missing Child Coordinator, Child Welfare Ombudsman
FBI Office of Professional Responsibility, DOJ Civil Rights Division, ACF (for foster care)

national_child_search_assistance_act.key_point: No waiting period; NCIC within 2 hours

print_ready_materials.description: Materials communities can print and distribute.
